content:
Krishna played a crucial role in helping Arjuna during the war as his charioteer and advisor. He guided Arjuna through the battlefield, providing him with wisdom and clarity, which helped Arjuna overcome his doubts and fears.

Krishna also utilized the chariot in several ways during the war. He made sure that the chariot was always in the right place at the right time, allowing Arjuna to make strategic moves and gain an advantage over his enemies. He also protected Arjuna from enemy attacks, using his divine powers to shield the chariot from harm.

Furthermore, Krishna used the chariot as a platform to impart the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita to Arjuna. He explained the nature of the self, the cycle of birth and death, and the importance of fulfilling one's duty. This knowledge helped Arjuna gain a deeper understanding of life and his role in the world, which enabled him to fight with renewed vigor and determination.
